success.line: This warmth... I had forgotten what it felt like. Thank you, Rehema. Maybe... maybe I can find peace after all.

failure.line: Oh... this isn't quite right. I suppose some things are beyond fixing.

success.line: It's... soothing. Like a whisper from the past telling me it's okay. Thank you, Rehema. Maybe now, I can move on.

failure.line: No... this isn't right. The regret still lingers, heavier than ever. I am still lost.

success.line: Ah... it reminds me of something I used to love. Maybe I haven't faded as much as I thought.

failure.line: I don't feel anything... just more emptiness. I guess some things are beyond repair.

success.line: I can see a flicker of light in the dark. Maybe I don't have to be lost forever.

failure.line: The fog hasn't lifted. Maybe it never will...

success.line: This taste... it reminds me of home. Maybe I'm not as alone as I thought.

failure.line: No... this isn't it. I still feel so... disconnected.

success.line: For the first time in a long while, I feel... settled. Thank you.

failure.line: Still drifting... still waiting. Maybe I always will be.

success.line: This fire inside me... I had forgotten it. Perhaps I am still here after all.

failure.line: Nothing stirs. I remain a shadow. Just as before.

success.line: This feeling... I think I can finally rest. Thank you, Rehema.

failure.line: No... I am still weary. Sleep eludes me, as always.

success.line: This flavor soothes my restless spirit. For the first time in ages, I feel at peace. Thank you.

failure.line: This... this is not what I longed for. The emptiness remains. I will keep waiting... forever.

success.line: Hah! You matched my fury beat for beat. I... I feel lighter. Maybe your help isn't so useless after all.

failure.line: Pathetic! You can't keep up! Your so-called kindness is nothing but weakness!

success.line: The fire's warmth… it's not just memory now. You've given me a piece of home I thought was lost forever.

failure.line: The ember flickered… but didn't catch. I suppose some nights remain cold, no matter how much you want the fire back.

success.line: I saw it—just for a moment. The shape of what haunts me. And for once, I didn't turn away.

failure.line: It slipped through again. Maybe some shadows are too dense… or maybe I'm still not ready to see.

success.line: It's like something long buried has started to stir. I don't know what's waiting ahead—but for the first time, I want to find out.

failure.line: I thought I felt something, but maybe it was just another mirage. Hope keeps slipping through my fingers.

success.line: It didn't bring the memories back, but… the ache has softened. And that's okay. I'll face them when I am ready.

failure.line: I thought I could finally see my memories... but it's just fog again. Maybe I'm not meant to remember at all.

success.line: This silence… it's different now. Not empty, but warm. You've made the stillness bearable.

failure.line: I feel the same suffocating weight, pressing down on me. Looks like I'm cursed to keep waiting…

success.line: I feel a flicker of hope. I am still here. Thank you… for the reminder.

failure.line: I reached for the light—but it passed through me. Maybe I've drifted too far after all.

success.line: It's not gone… but it doesn't claw the same way. You've shown me a gentler way to carry it.

failure.line: No shift. No change. Just the same pain in a different cup.

success.line: ...Thank you.
The storm's still there… but it's quieter now. I can finally be at peace.

failure.line: The noise came back as soon as it left. Maybe there's no calm for a mind like mine.

success.line: ...I didn't think anything could reach me. But this… it cracked something open. Maybe there's still a piece of me worth saving.

failure.line: Tch. Weak. You'll need more than that to melt this kind of fury.

success.line: The fire... it's calmed. I can finally feel the coolness of the air around me, and for the first time, I think I'm ready to move forward.

failure.line: The flames rage on. Nothing has changed. I'm still caught in this unending cycle.

success.line: I can almost feel the warmth again, like I'm coming back to life. It's not the same as before, but it's a start.

failure.line: It's still cold... the emptiness lingers. I'm not sure if anything can fill this void.

success.line: The stillness is so peaceful. It's like the weight of the world has lifted, and I can hear myself again.

failure.line: The silence... it doesn't last. The sorrow returns, and I am lost beneath it once more.

success.line: I see myself now—whole, not broken. Maybe this is who I was always meant to be.

failure.line: The reflection... it's still fractured. I'm not sure I'll ever recognize who I've become.

success.line: The fog has lifted. I can see clearly now, and I feel lighter—like I've freed myself from the past.

failure.line: The fog is still here, thick as ever. The past continues to haunt me, and I can't escape it.

success.line: I can feel both worlds now, intertwined. The past and present have found their place together, and I feel... whole again.

failure.line: I'm still caught in between. The gap is too wide, and I can't seem to bridge the two worlds.

success.line: I feel the warmth again, like a spark of life. It's not the same as it once was, but it's enough to keep me going.

failure.line: The warmth is gone again. I'm left with only the cold of the past, and nothing seems to change.

success.line: I can feel the earth beneath me now, grounding me. It's like a piece of who I was has come back to me.

failure.line: The ground is still slipping through my fingers. I'm still lost, with no sense of where I belong.

success.line: For the first time in so long, I feel lighter. The weight has shifted, if only for a moment. I can breathe again.

failure.line: The sorrow is still here, pressing down on me. I can't escape it. It's like a shadow that never leaves.
